args:
The blacksmith sisters are downtrodden after
coming face-to-face with their rival Lazry's
overwhelming skills. Rena then recalls the
existence of a dragon who trained her father,
so the party sets off for the volcano where he
resides in order to help the sisters improve.

The three blacksmith sisters poured all of their
know-how into completing their sword for the
Golden Anvil, and emerged with a weapon that was
at the absolute peak of their current abilities.
Everyone then heads into town to submit the\nsword for consideration by the blacksmith's guild.
Maaaaaybe we should check the sword\nonce more. You know? Just to be sure?
It's going to look the same as it did the\nlast nineteen times you checked.\nDon't worry, Renee—it's going to be fine.
We let everything out on the forge,\nso let's walk in with our heads high.
Wait, what's going on at the huge\nhearth outside that building?

That there's a rokkan smithin' hearth.
Thing gets hotter'n any hearth around,
but they can't fit it inside what 'cause
it's so damn big.
Ye be the lassies from Regis's shop, aye?\n...Ah, and I reckon that there's a sword\nfor the contest.
Yep! Feast your eyes, pal, because THIS\nbaby is gonna walk away with first prize!
Aye, she's a fine sword, and no mistake.\nGood, quality work, that is.
That said, it'll be me own sword\nwhat takes home the prize.
We've all seen your work, Lazry, and it's\ngood—but we've got you beat today.
Ye talkin' 'bout the weapons what I\nshow in me shop? Aye, those be fine,\nbut they ain't what I put my all into.
Wait. Are you ADMITTING that you've been\ncutting corners on your products?!
Blimey, lass, no! No corners cut here!\nBut if I were to put me all into a weapon,\nshe'd be too much for a regular person.
Ye lassies'll see what I mean once\nI'm done forgin' me weapon here.
Pffft. SOMEBODY'S confident today.\nBut yeah, sure—show us what you got.
Whoa, that forge is BLAZING hot!\nLazry's going to burst into flame\nif she stands any closer!
...And yet, she's not even sweating.\nPlus, look at her—she's swinging that\nmassive hammer with one arm!
Yeah, rokkan folk are sturdy, all right.\nFor them, heat like this is like a mild\nspring day for you'n me.
Plus their fingers are long and deft,\nand they got muscles to spare.\nThey were pretty much born to smith.
There's almost something...beautiful\nabout watching Lazry work.

B-but that doesn't mean anything!
A weapon is about grace and substance
and all of that—not just how good you
look when you're making it!
True, lass—which is why it's what's IN\nme sword that makes 'er so exceptional.
Ho, lad! Ye seem to be quite the burly\nfellow—might I ask ye to hold me sword\naloft there for a minute?
Bwaaaa ha ha! Ain't a sword made yet\nwhat I can't—HUUURK! Sweet ham salad,\nthis thing's heavy as hell!
Well done, lad! Didn't think ye'd\nbe able to even lift 'er, so I didn't.

This here sword was hewn with three times
the usual amount of iron for a blade of its
size—then I pressed it down into a single
blade using me own special technique.
This sword could chop a dragon in half!\nI mean, if ya could WIELD the damn thing.
Aye, she can be wielded, all right...\nby a ROKKAN warrior.
So that's what you meant when you said\na regular person couldn't handle it.
Aye. But for a weapon being entered in\nthe competition, ye don't really need to\nworry 'bout that sort'a thing.
Whew! That plum tuckered me out, it did.\nTime to take me a little nap.
That sword was... It was amazing.\nI've never seen anything like it...
Y-yeah, but OUR sword is still better!\nI mean...um...right?
Come on now, you two.\nLet's put on our happy faces.
It's quite possible we can't beat Lazry now.\nBut in that case, we'll just figure out how\nto beat her another day!
We've done good work up until now,\nbut we still have room to improve.
Yeah, but HOW do we improve?\nAin't like we can just snap our\nfingers and be better smiths.
Well, I was thinking about something\nDad said to me once...
Apparently, when he was young,\nhe ran into much the same situation\nas we find ourselves in now.
Yep! But rather than mope about it,\nhe went off to a volcano, trained under\na special dragon coach, and improved.
Wait, he was coached by a DRAGON?!\nThat's RAD! I wanna be coached by\na freakin' dragon right noooow!
Only a loser would throw in the towel\nnow—and I sure as hell ain't no loser!
Hee hee! Oh, it's good to see my sisters\nback to their usual fiery selves.
I'd like to help with this plan as well.\nAfter all, the better you get, the more\nit ends up improving all of us.
So if you'll have me, ladies,\nlead the way to the volcano!
